page.title: 06FARMING CHANGES(NEWICK AREA)
page.content: The thing that has brought about the biggest change in local farming over the last 30 years or so, has been the introduction of large machinery. The farm manager who talked to us, said that in 1958, 48 men were employed to farm the 2,500 acres that he managed. Today, only 13 men are needed. Today, it takes one man just two hours to milk 140 cows by machine. Field sizes have been greatly increased so that large machines can be used in them more economically. The barns that held about a dozen cows are no longer used. Two barns by the Church are being renovated; one is now a very attractive house and the other is to become a Church Hall. The small farms have been amalgamated to form more profitable units, and the farmhouses have become very desirable, private residences.
